TITLE: Basic Motion Animation in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the simplest form of using Motion to animate a div element. It demonstrates how to apply an animation to move the element horizontally using the 'animate' prop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/packages/framer-motion/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<motion.div animate={{ x: 0 }} />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Animating Opacity with Motion Component in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the Motion component to animate the opacity of a div element based on a visibility prop. It shows the basic syntax for importing and using Motion in a React component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/packages/framer-motion/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { motion } from "motion/react"

export function Component({ isVisible }) {
    return <motion.div animate={{ opacity: isVisible ? 1 : 0 }} />
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the motion component in React
DESCRIPTION: Basic example of using the motion component to create an animation in React. This shows the core syntax of Motion for React with a simple x-position animation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/packages/motion/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<motion.div animate={{ x: 0 }} />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and using Motion in a React component
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to import the motion component from the library and use it to create an opacity animation based on a visibility state prop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/packages/motion/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { motion } from "motion/react"

export function Component({ isVisible }) {
    return <motion.div animate={{ opacity: isVisible ? 1 : 0 }} />
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Animated Components with Motion in React
DESCRIPTION: Example of using Motion's React API to create an animated div component that moves 100 pixels along the x-axis.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
import { motion } from "motion/react"

function Component() {
    return <motion.div animate={{ x: 100 }} />
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Animating Elements with Motion in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Basic example of using Motion's JavaScript API to animate an element by moving it 100 pixels along the x-axis.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { animate } from "motion"

animate("#box", { x: 100 })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Motion for React
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Motion for React library via npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/packages/motion/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install motion
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Motion via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Motion animation library using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install motion
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Motion development environment
DESCRIPTION: The steps required to set up a development environment for contributing to the Motion project, including forking, cloning, installing dependencies, and preparing code for a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
1. Fork the Motion repo.
2. Clone your fork to your local computer.
3. Install [Yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/).
4. Run `make bootstrap` in the repo root.
5. Add your code and supporting tests.
6. If this is a feature that requires doc changes, make as necessary.
7. Update CHANGELOG.md. Follow the existing format.
8. You're ready!
```

TITLE: Accessing Motion Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for accessing the Motion development server at the specified port 9990 with capability to view example files and run specific tests via URL parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/dev/react-19/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
http://localhost:9990
```

TITLE: Running the Motion React Dev Environment from Command Line
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server from the motion root directory using yarn.
SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/dev/react/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn dev
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/motiondivision/motion/blob/main/dev/html/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0
